text: The Nativity of the Lord Christmas December 25 2022 Merry Christmas Whether you are a longtime parishioner or a visiting guest we are so happy that you have joined us this weekend to celebrate the Nativity of our Lord Jesus Christ May the Lord fill your hearts with the joy of His peace and love as we continue celebrating the birth of the Christ child There are always so many people to thank for helping make our celebration of the Nativity of the Lord so beautiful Our choirs who practiced for months to help us lift our hearts to the Lord our church decorators our altar servers who inspire us with their reverence our parish staff Michelle Teresa and Stacey and all those who helped in anyway over these past many days We are also particularly grateful to you for choosing to celebrate with us It is always great to welcome so many guests and to see old friends back home for the holidays If it's your first time here at St Joseph's with us we would love to welcome you back soon throughout the Christmas season and beyond Continuing with our liturgical year's focus on prayer as summarized by the passage from St Luke's Gospel of Lord Teach Us to Pray our parish Christmas gift for all families this year is St Francis de Sales spiritual classic An Introduction to the Devout Life This gift is available for all of our parish households and visiting guests in the Narthex this weekend Born in 1567 to an old aristocrat family St Francis de Sales was the eldest of his twelve siblings Though his father desired that he take on a career within the political life of the day St Francis instead felt the call to the priesthood After a number of years he eventually gained his father's approval and began formation for priesthood After his ordination St Francis would eventually become known for his missionary activity his spiritual writings and would be named as the Bishop of Geneva in modern day France He served faithfully in this role for over two decades Following his death in 1622 he was canonized or recognized as a Saint in 1665 His writings including An Introduction to the Devout Life have been seen as such timeless spiritual works that St Francis was named as a Doctor of the Church in 1877 An Introduction to the Devout Life is a book to be read with pencil in hand It is a book to be read again and again Its aim is to help rid the reader of sin and even the inclinations to sin No one will come away from this work without being profoundly impressed and without being motivated to enter upon the devout life which leads ultimately to God and Heaven May this classic serve to deepen our relationship with the Lord and bring us closer to Heaven MASS INTENTIONS Saturday December 24 Christmas Eve 8:00am Special Intention 4:00pm Robert Mary Haecker Trent Workshop Join Right to Life of Northeast Indiana on Saturday January 14 2023 from 9am to Noon hosted at St Joseph Catholic Church 1300 Main St Bluffton Indiana Many people today reject or are indifferent to the pro life view often because they've never heard the pro life position presented in a compelling manner Life Defenders will prepare you to confidently communicate the pro life position to others Using science philosophy you will learn to simplify the debate Come learn to how to speak intelligently and graciously to the most pressing moral issue of our time abortion You'll leave prepared to confidently persuade others by exposing the logical fallacies of abortion choice rhetoric without the need for vitriol and angry dialogue This workshop is 5 per person and is open to ages 7th Grade and older Please register online at wwwichooselifeorgLDBluffton or by calling (260)471-1849 Coffee and doughnuts provided Join thousands of pro life advocates from our region to show support for life from conception to natural death The Fort Wayne March for Life is a yearly pro life rally held near the anniversary of Roe v Wade the 1973 Supreme Court decision legalizing abortion The Rally will take place at University of St Francis Performing Arts Center 431 Berry St Fort Wayne at 12pm The March will start after the Rally This year's keynote speaker is pro life advocate and Hoosier Katie Shaw Katie serves on the board of Down Syndrome Indiana and has lobbied at the Statehouse for pro life legislation As person with Down Syndrome Katie's work demonstrates that our abilities are not limited by the perception of others Katies courage tenacity and faith are sure to encourage the pro life community of Northeast Indiana Save the Date ANUARY 28 2023 Fort Wayne March
